intro: Gynoxys trianae, commonly known as the Trianas' gynoxys, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, red or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
